UpperArmsDBConcentrationCurl.name: Dumbbell Concentration Curl
UpperArmsDBConcentrationCurl.preparation: Sit on bench. Grasp dumbbell between feet. Place back of upper arm to inner thigh. Lean into leg to raise elbow slightly.
UpperArmsDBConcentrationCurl.execution: Raise dumbbell to front of shoulder. Lower dumbbell until arm is fully extended. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
UpperArmsDBConcentrationCurl.comments: The long head (lateral head) of biceps brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of biceps brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract.
UpperArmsDBConcentrationCurl.stabilizers: trapeziusupper, trapeziusmiddle, erectorspinae, levatorscapulae, wristflexors, obliques

UpperArmsDBPreacherCurl.name: Dumbbell Preacher Curl
UpperArmsDBPreacherCurl.preparation: Grasp dumbbell and sit on preacher bench. With arm bent and palm facing shoulder, place back of arm down on pad.
UpperArmsDBPreacherCurl.execution: Lower dumbbell until arm is fully extended. Raise dumbbell until forearm is vertical. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
UpperArmsDBPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. Long head (lateral head) of biceps brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of biceps brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract.

UpperArmsDBStandingPreacherCurl.name: Dumbbell Standing Preacher Curl
UpperArmsDBStandingPreacherCurl.preparation: With dummbell in hand, arm bent, and palm facing shoulder, place back of arm on pad.
UpperArmsDBStandingPreacherCurl.execution: Lower dumbbell until arm is fully extended. Raise dumbbell until forearm is vertical. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
UpperArmsDBStandingPreacherCurl.comments: Body should be positioned to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. Long head (lateral head) of biceps brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of biceps brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract.

UpperArmsDBProneInclineCurl.name: Dumbbell Prone Incline Curl
UpperArmsDBProneInclineCurl.preparation: Lie prone on incline bench with shoulders near top of incline. Knees can rest on seat or legs can be straddled to sides. From elevated platform or partner, grasp dumbbell and position palms forward.
UpperArmsDBProneInclineCurl.execution: Raise dumbbells until arms are flexed. Lower dumbbells until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
UpperArmsDBProneInclineCurl.comments: Also known as Dumbbell Spider Curl. The long head (lateral head) of biceps brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of biceps brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract.
